CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 31, 1938, pg. 7, reads: "Pretty Girls...Pretty Frocks...Pretty Bride at Withington - Jordan Nuptials - Smoketown witnessed one of the fashionable events of nuptial and Christmas night when lovely Dorothy Withington and Howard Jordan were married in Bride's home in Winfield street. Courier Cameraman Harris clicked the camera on the bride and her maids. Left to right, Miss Jean McClanahan, Miss Helen Phillips, Mrs. Carrie Web-Jackson, matron of honor; the bride, Miss Gladys Guster; maid of honor, Miss Elvira Guster, and Imogene Withington, sister of the bride. The gowns were [wore] pastel shades of yellow, blue, green and rose.  The bride wore white velvet."
TitMainTitle: Women of wedding party from left: Jean McClanahan, Helen Phillips, Carrie Web - Jackson, bride Dorothy Withington Jordan wearing velvet gown and holding bouquet of calla lilies, Gladys Guster, Elvira Guster, and Imogene Withington, posed in interior decorated with ferns and portrait painting of woman
